docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 20 -- A narcotics case in New Jersey was leading today to a spreading scandal in the French secret service.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 20 -- A narcotics case in New Jersey was leading today to a spreading scandal in the French secret service.

headline.main: French Secret Service Scandal Spreads in Wake of Drug Case

byline.original: By JOHN L. HESSSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: TACUAREMBO, Uruguay, Nov. 14 -- In the Uruguayan range country around Tacuarembo distances across the prairie are still measured in leagues and until recently politics was seen in only two colors: the white of the Nationals and the red of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: TACUAREMBO, Uruguay, Nov. 14 -- In the Uruguayan range country around Tacuarembo distances across the prairie are still measured in leagues and until recently politics was seen in only two colors: the white of the Nationals and the red of the Colorados, the two parties that have governed the country for more than a century.
docs.abstract: leftist coalition called Broad Front seen introducing 3d factor in election traditionally predominated by 2 parties; Front candidate is Gen L Seregni Mosquera (ret), with platform modeled closely after that of Chilean Pres Allende; promises agrarian reform, nationalization of all private banks and foreign trade, anti-imperialist foreign policy; rural Uruguayans consider past regimes failures but are wary of Communists in coalition; rancher illus

headline.main: Rural Uruguayans Wary Of Communist Candidates

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 25 -- Hundreds of times this year small herds of Uruguayan cattle have walked slowly across some deserted stretch of the Brazil-Uruguay border and turned up the next day as Brazilian beef -- worth about three times more on...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 25 -- Hundreds of times this year small herds of Uruguayan cattle have walked slowly across some deserted stretch of the Brazil-Uruguay border and turned up the next day as Brazilian beef -- worth about three times more on the hoof.
docs.abstract: deep econ uneasiness in Uruguay described; current electioneering policies threaten econ, with Pres Pacheco abandoning in part 3 yrs of econ stabilization; he has held back inflationary pressures, postponed foreign debt payments and suspended debts outside Uruguay's banking system in reelection campaign

headline.main: Economic Uneasiness Fills Uruguay as Election Nears; Uruguay Economic Future Hazy as Voting Nears

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The most encouraging thing that can be said about the elections in Uruguay is that they will be held Sunday on schedule. For a country racked by prolonged economic depression and polarized by the urban terrorism of left-wing revolutionaries, that is...
docs.lead_paragraph: The most encouraging thing that can be said about the elections in Uruguay is that they will be held Sunday on schedule. For a country racked by prolonged economic depression and polarized by the urban terrorism of left-wing revolutionaries, that is no small achievement. In this area Uruguay thus continues to set an example for most of Latin America.
docs.abstract: ed on election foresees profound impact of leftist showing on Latin-Amer pol

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 26 -- Uruguay's popular front coalition, which is attempting to follow the Chilean way to power, held a roaring "victory" rally for well over 100,000 people here Wednesday night, and its presidential candidate declared,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 26 -- Uruguay's popular front coalition, which is attempting to follow the Chilean way to power, held a roaring "victory" rally for well over 100,000 people here Wednesday night, and its presidential candidate declared, "Comrades, the front has already triumphed!"
docs.abstract: coalition holds huge 'victory' rally just before election day; campaign posters illus; some coalition leaders say they do not expect to win pres but do expect election results to make left new and powerful force in Uruguayan pol

headline.main: 100,000 Uruguay Leftists Hold a 'Victory' Rally Ahead of the Poll

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BINGHAMTON seems an extremely unlikely place for a world premiere. One hardly associates first nights and import literary events with this pleasant city of some 80,000 people in the Southern Tier area of New York, midway between Syracuse and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BINGHAMTON seems an extremely unlikely place for a world premiere. One hardly associates first nights and import literary events with this pleasant city of some 80,000 people in the Southern Tier area of New York, midway between Syracuse and Scranton.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 27 -- Jorge Berenbau, a young textile factory owner held by urban guerrillas since July, was reliably reported today to have been released on the eve of the national elections.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 27 -- Jorge Berenbau, a young textile factory owner held by urban guerrillas since July, was reliably reported today to have been released on the eve of the national elections.
docs.abstract: Factory owner J Berenbau, kidnapped by Tupamaros in July, reptdly freed on eve of election; over 60 people held by Uruguayan Govt for alleged involvement with Tupamaros

headline.main: Captive of the Tupamaros Reported Free in Uruguay

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO -- Elections used to mean fun in Uruguay, with noisy rallies and broiled beef and red wine for campaign workers or anyone who stopped by a political clubhouse. The old-style happiness of a presidential campaign has lifted a mood of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO -- Elections used to mean fun in Uruguay, with noisy rallies and broiled beef and red wine for campaign workers or anyone who stopped by a political clubhouse. The old-style happiness of a presidential campaign has lifted a mood of national depression in the past two months, but the elections today will be held in a new-style world full of trouble and few easy choices.
docs.abstract: Election campaign described as having striking similarities with '70 Chilean campaign; Colorados and National parties tacitly converge in anti-Communist publicity drive against Front

headline.main: Another Chile In the Making?; Uruguay:

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28--The heaviest voter turnout in Uruguay's history, drawn by a presidential election today that offered choices ranging from socialism through liberal reform to an anti-Communist appeal for law and order, forced officials...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28--The heaviest voter turnout in Uruguay's history, drawn by a presidential election today that offered choices ranging from socialism through liberal reform to an anti-Communist appeal for law and order, forced officials to extend polling throughout this small country until midnight.
docs.abstract: heavy voter turnout sets record, forcing officials to extend polling until midnight; underscores radicalization of pol since '66 elections; campaign began on basic issue of how to hall steady econ decline and became choice between radical solutions of left and of traditional parties

headline.main: Voter Turnout in Uruguay Sets a Record

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 29 -- Agriculture Minister Juan M. Bordaberry, the handpicked Presidential candidate of President Jorge Pacheco Areco, appeared today to be headed for victory in yesterday's elections.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 29 -- Agriculture Minister Juan M. Bordaberry, the handpicked Presidential candidate of President Jorge Pacheco Areco, appeared today to be headed for victory in yesterday's elections.
docs.abstract: Min Bordaberry, handpicked Pros candidate of Pros Pacheco, apparent victor in election; illus; incomplete returns show Front poor 3d to 2 traditional parties; Pacheco loses bid for re-election through referendum but results are regarded as victory for him over pol left and Tupamaros; Pacheco earlier made last-min appeal to people's fear of radical change and Communism

headline.main: LEFT'S COALITION LOSES IN URUGUAY; Candidate of Ruling Party Well Ahead in Vote Count

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times
